get.description: Get the questionnaire for a specific id
Get questionnaire responses for a specific id

resourceType.description: Indicates this is a domain resource of type 'OperationOutcome'

issue.description: A single issue associated with the action

resourceType.description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR

id.description: Each resource has an id element which contains the 'logical id' of the resource assigned by the server responsible for storing it

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

text.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it 'clinically safe' for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

url.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this questionnaire when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this questionnaire is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the questionnaire is stored on different servers.

identifier.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this questionnaire when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

version.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the questionnaire when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the questionnaire author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

name.description: A natural language name identifying the questionnaire. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

title.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the questionnaire.

status.description: The status of this questionnaire. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.  | Permissible values:   draft |   active |   retired |   unknown

subjectType.description: The types of subjects that can be the subject of responses created for the questionnaire. Permissable Values: Organization: Includes Aged Care Organisations and Service Providers | HealthCareService: The Facility, or Service Outlet providing a Service at a Location | Patient: The Care Recipient, Client or Service Consumer

date.description: The date (and optionally time) when the questionnaire was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the questionnaire changes. ISO8601: YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss:sss

responsePeriod.description: The start and end date period for which the Questionnaire will be enabled to receive responses

reportingPeriod.description: The start and end date period that the questions in the questionnaire are related to.

item.description: A particular question, question grouping or display text that is part of the questionnaire

id.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

status.description: The position of the questionnaire response within its overall lifecycle. Permissible Values: in-progress | completed | amended | entered-in-error | stopped

identifier.description: A business identifier assigned to a particular completed (or partially completed) questionnaire.

questionnaire.description: The Questionnaire that defines and organizes the questions for which answers are being provided.

subject.description: The subject of the questionnaire response.  This could be a Patient (care Recipient, Client, Service consumer), Organization (ACO, Service Provider), HealthcareService, Practitioner, Device, etc.  This is who/what the answers apply to, but is not necessarily the source of information. For QI, this will be a HealthcareService, identifying the Service that the QI is submitting for.

authored.description: The date and/or time that this set of answers were last changed. ISO8601: YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss:sss

author.description: Person who received the answers to the questions in the QuestionnaireResponse and recorded them in the system.

item.description: A group or question item from the original questionnaire for which answers are provided.

use.description: usual | official | temp | secondary | old (If known)

system.description: The namespace for the identifier value

period.description: Time period when id is/was valid for use

severity.description: Indicates whether the issue indicates a variation from successful processing. fatal | error | warning | information | success | bounded to https://www.hl7.org/fhir/valueset-issue-severity.html (required)

code.description: Describes the type of the issue. The system that creates an OperationOutcome SHALL choose the most applicable code from the IssueType value set, and may additional provide its own code for the error in the details element.

details.description: Describes the type of the issue. The system that creates an OperationOutcome SHALL choose the most applicable code from the IssueType value set, and may additional provide its own code for the error in the details element. Binding: https://www.hl7.org/fhir/valueset-operation-outcome.html (example)

coding.description: Code defined by a terminology system

text.description: Plain text representation of the concept

diagnostics.description: Additional diagnostic information about the issue.

expression.description: A simple subset of FHIRPath limited to element names, repetition indicators and the default child accessor that identifies one of the elements in the resource that caused this issue to be raised.

coding.description: Code defined by a terminology system

text.description: Plain text representation of the concept

reference.description: Literal reference, Relative, internal or absolute URL

identifier.description: Logical reference, when literal reference is not known

start.description: The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive. ISO8601: YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss:sss

end.description: The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive. ISO8601: YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss:sss

linkId.description: Unique id for item in questionnaire | + Warning: Link ids should be 255 characters or less

text.description: The name of a section, the text of a question or text content for a display item.

type.description: The type of questionnaire item this is - whether text for display, a grouping of other items or a particular type of data to be captured (string, integer, coded choice, etc.). Permissable values: group | display | boolean | decimal | integer | date | dateTime +

code.description: Corresponding concept for this item in a terminology | A terminology code that corresponds to this group or question (e.g. a code from LOINC, which defines many questions and answers).

item.description: Text, questions and other groups to be nested beneath a question or group.

enableBehaviour.description: Describes whether all or any (just one) of the enableWhen criteria need to be met | Permitted values: all | any

enableWhen.description: Only allow data when | + Rule: If the operator is 'exists', the value must be a boolean

required.description: Whether the item must be included in data results | An indication, if true, that the item must be present in a 'completed' QuestionnaireResponse. If false, the item may be skipped when answering the questionnaire.

readOnly.description: Don't allow human editing | An indication, when true, that the value cannot be changed by a human respondent to the Questionnaire.

maxLength.description: No more than this many characters | The maximum number of characters that are permitted in the answer to be considered a 'valid' QuestionnaireResponse.

answerOption.description: Permitted answer | A potential answer that's allowed as the answer to this question.

initial.description: Initial value(s) when item is first rendered | One or more values that should be pre-populated in the answer when initially rendering the questionnaire for user input.

linkId.description: The item from the Questionnaire that corresponds to this item in the QuestionnaireResponse resource.

text.description: Text that is displayed above the contents of the group or as the text of the question being answered.

answer.description: The respondent's answer(s) to the question.

item.description: Questions or sub-groups nested beneath a question or group.

version.description: Version of the system - if relevant

code.description: Symbol in syntax defined by the system

userSelected.description: If this coding was chosen directly by the user

question.description: Question that determines whether item is enabled

operator.description: Specifies the criteria by which the question is enabled. exists | = | != | > | < | >= | <=

answerBoolean.description: Value for question comparison based on operator

answerDecimal.description: Value for question comparison based on operator

answerInteger.description: Value for question comparison based on operator

answerDate.description: Value for question comparison based on operator | ISO8601: YYYY-MM-DD

answerDateTime.description: Value for question comparison based on operator | ISO8601: YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss:sss

answerTime.description: Value for question comparison based on operator

answerString.description: Value for question comparison based on operator

answerCoding.description: Value for question comparison based on operator

answerQuantity.description: Value for question comparison based on operator

answerReference.description: Value for question comparison based on operator

initialSelected.description: Whether option is selected by default

valueBoolean.description: Actual value for initializing the question

valueDecimal.description: Actual value for initializing the question

valueInteger.description: Actual value for initializing the question

valueDate.description: Actual value for initializing the question | ISO8601: YYYY-MM-DD

valueDateTime.description: Actual value for initializing the question | ISO8601: YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss:sss

valueTime.description: Actual value for initializing the question

valueString.description: Actual value for initializing the question

valueUri.description: Actual value for initializing the question

valueAttachment.description: Actual value for initializing the question

valueCoding.description: Actual value for initializing the question

valueQuantity.description: Actual value for initializing the question

valueReference.description: Actual value for initializing the question

id.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

valueBoolean.description: The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.

valueDecimal.description: The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.

valueInteger.description: The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.

valueDate.description: The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question. ISO8601: YYYY-MM-DD

valueDateTime.description: The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question. ISO8601: YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss:sss

valueTime.description: The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.

valueString.description: The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.

valueUri.description: The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.

valueAttachment.description: The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.

valueCoding.description: The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.

valueQuantity.description: The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.

valueReference.description: The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.

creation.description: Date attachment was first created | ISO8601: YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss:sss

size.description: Number of bytes of content (if url provided)

url.description: Uri where the data can be found

contentType.description: Mime type of the content, with charset etc.

title.description: Label to display in place of the data

comparator.description: < | <= | >= | > - how to understand the value | use ValueSet: http://hl7.org/fhir/valueset-quantity-comparator.html

system.description: System that defines coded unit form

url.description: identifies the meaning of the extension

valuePeriod.description: The Reporting Period that the Questionnaire Response is targeting for submission. Provide either the start date of the Reporting Period or the end date or both.

start.description: The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive. ISO8601: YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss:sss

end.description: The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive. ISO8601: YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss:sss

url.description: identifies the meaning of the extension

valueDate.description: The Reporting Period that the Questionnaire Response is targeting for submission. Provide either the start date of the Reporting Period or the end date or both.

url.description: identifies the meaning of the extension

valueDate.description: The Reporting Period that the Questionnaire Response is targeting for submission. Provide either the start date of the Reporting Period or the end date or both.

item.text: Number of care recipients assessed for pressure injuries
Number of care recipients excluded because they withheld consent to undergo an observation assessment for pressure injuries for the entire quarter
Number of care recipients excluded because they were absent from the service for the entire quarter
Number of care recipients with one or more pressure injuries
Number of care recipients with one or more pressure injuries reported against each of the six pressure injury stages:
Number of care recipients with one or more pressure injuries acquired outside of the service during the quarter, reported against each of the six pressure injury stages:
Number of care recipients with one or more pressure injuries acquired outside of the service during the quarter
The collection date for the quarter
Number of care recipients whose records were assessed for Physical Restraint over the three-day assessment period.
Number of care recipients excluded because they were absent from the service for the entire three-day assessment period
Number of care recipients physically restrained (once or more and including through the use of secure areas) on any occasion during the three-day assessment period.
Number of care recipients physically restrained during the three-day assessment period exclusively through the use of a secure area.
Number of care recipients assessed for significant unplanned weight loss
Number of care recipients excluded because they withheld consent to be weighed on the finishing weight collection date
Number of care recipients excluded because they are receiving end-of-life care
Number of care recipients excluded because they did not have the required weights recorded (e.g. previous and/or finishing weights). Include comments as to why the weight recording/s are absent
Number of care recipients who experienced significant unplanned weight loss of 5% or more when comparing their finishing weight and previous weight
Number of care recipients assessed for consecutive unplanned weight loss
Number of care recipients excluded because they withheld consent to be weighed on the starting, middle and/or finishing weight collection dates
Number of care recipients excluded because they are receiving end-of-life care

Number of care recipients excluded because they did not have the required weights recorded (e.g. previous, starting, middle and/or finishing weights). Include comments as to why the weight recording/s are absent
Number of care recipients who experienced consecutive unplanned weight loss of any amount when comparing their previous, starting, middle and finishing weights
Number of care recipients assessed for falls and major injury
Number of care recipients excluded because they were absent from the service for the entire quarter
Number of care recipients who experienced one or more falls at the service during the quarter
Number of care recipients who experienced one or more falls at the service resulting in major injury during the quarter
The collection date for the quarter
Number of care recipients assessed for polypharmacy
Number of care recipients excluded because they were admitted to hospital on the collection date
Number of care recipients prescribed nine or more medications based on a review of their medication charts and/or administration records as they are on the collection date
The collection date for the quarter
Number of care recipients assessed for antipsychotic medications
Number of care recipients excluded because they were admitted in hospital for the entire seven-day assessment period
Number of care recipients who received an antipsychotic medication
Number of care recipients who received an antipsychotic medication for a medically diagnosed condition of psychosis
Number of care recipients assessed for ADL function (using the Barthel Index of Activities of Daily Living assessment tool)
Number of care recipients excluded because they are receiving end-of-life care
Number of care recipients excluded because they were absent from the service for the entire quarter
Number of care recipients excluded because they did not have an ADL assessment total score recorded for the previous quarter. Include comments as to why the previous recording is absent
Number of care recipients with an ADL assessment total score of zero in the previous quarter
Number of care recipients who experienced a decline in ADL assessment total score of one or more points
Number of care recipients assessed for incontinence care
Number of care recipients excluded because they were absent from the service for the entire quarter
Number of care recipients excluded from incontinence associated dermatitis (IAD) assessment because they did not have incontinence
Number of care recipients with incontinence
Number of care recipients with incontinence who experienced IAD
Number of care recipients with incontinence who experienced IAD, reported against each of the four IAD sub-categories
1A: Persistent redness without clinical signs of infection
1B: Persistent redness with clinical signs of infection
2A: Skin loss without clinical signs of infection
2B: Skin loss with clinical signs of infection
Number of care recipients assessed for hospitalisation
Number of care recipients excluded because they were absent from the service for the entire quarter
Number of care recipients who had one or more emergency department presentations during the quarter
Number of care recipients who had one or more emergency department presentations or hospital admissions during the quarter
